system.description: A finely crafted power blade originating from the forges of Desoleum. Slender and elegant, it is favoured by nobles and duellists who appreciate its perfect balance and devastating cutting ability.

A miniaturised laspistol concealed within a ring, bracelet, or other piece of jewellery. Digi-weapons are rare and exotic, favoured by nobles, assassins, and those who value discretion. Each digi-weapon contains only a single shot before it must be recharged.
A miniaturised needler concealed within a ring, bracelet, or other piece of jewellery. Fires a single toxic needle with devastating effect on unarmoured targets.
A sophisticated needler weapon of xenos origin, adapted for human use. It fires crystalline shards that shatter upon impact, releasing a potent neurotoxin that incapacitates the target.

A blade of unknown xenos origin that phases partially out of realspace when swung, passing through armour as though it were not there. The blade shimmers with an unsettling translucence that suggests it exists simultaneously in multiple dimensions.

A rare piece of Imperial archeotech, the graviton grenade generates a localised gravity distortion upon detonation. Targets within the blast are crushed by waves of intensified gravity, and the affected area becomes difficult terrain.

A massive two-handed hammer fitted with a graviton pulse generator in the head. On impact, it releases a devastating graviton pulse that crushes and staggers the target with localised gravitational forces.
A sophisticated archeotech device that projects hard-light constructs capable of inflicting real damage. The projections can take any form, from blinding flashes to razor-sharp geometric shapes.

A devastating heavy weapon that fires concentrated beams of disintegrating energy. Based on xenos technology reverse-engineered by radical Mechanicus factions, each shot can reduce a target to its component atoms.

A compact, wrist-mounted weapon that fires volleys of razor-sharp crystalline quills. Originally of xenos design, it has been adapted for use by Imperial agents who value its concealability and silent operation.
A sophisticated defensive device that projects a shimmering energy barrier. Can be used both as a defensive shield and as a melee weapon, slamming enemies with the concentrated energy field.

A Dark Eldar weapon designed to inflict the maximum possible pain on its victims. The agoniser stimulates every pain receptor in the target's body simultaneously, causing excruciating agony that can incapacitate or kill. It can take the form of a whip, gauntlet, or other implement.

An elegant Eldar explosive device that detonates in a contained sphere of superheated plasma. More refined than crude Imperial frag grenades, the plasma grenade leaves no shrapnelâ€”only scorched earth and the ashes of the enemy.

An elegantly crafted blade of wraithbone and psychically-attuned crystal, the Eldar power sword is lighter and more agile than its Imperial counterpart. It channels the wielder's psychic energy to create a devastating cutting edge.

A weapon unique to the Harlequins of the Eldar, the Kiss is a wrist-mounted device that extends a monofilament wire tube into the target on contact. The wire then uncoils inside the victim, shredding organs and turning their insides to a bloody pulp.

A Dark Eldar ranged weapon that fires bursts of crystalline shards coated in lethal toxins. More rapid-firing than a splinter rifle, the shardcarbine is favoured by Scourges and other fast-moving Dark Eldar warriors.

A heavy support weapon of Eldar Craftworld design. The shuriken cannon uses a sophisticated gravitic accelerator to hurl a devastating hail of monomolecular-edged discs at extreme velocity, capable of shredding armour and flesh alike.

The standard ranged weapon of the Eldar Craftworlds, the shuriken catapult hurls a stream of razor-sharp monomolecular discs using a sophisticated gravitic accelerator. Despite its alien elegance, it is a devastating weapon of war.

A compact sidearm version of the Eldar shuriken catapult. Though smaller, it retains the devastating cutting power of its larger cousin and is standard equipment for Eldar warriors who need a one-handed ranged weapon.

The heaviest infantry-portable Dark Eldar splinter weapon, the splinter cannon fires a devastating hail of toxic crystal splinters capable of shredding entire squads. It is typically mounted on vehicles or carried by dedicated heavy weapons specialists.

The standard sidearm of the Dark Eldar, the splinter pistol fires crystalline shards coated in virulent toxins. Compact and elegant in its cruelty, it is designed to cause maximum pain with every hit.

The primary infantry weapon of the Dark Eldar, the splinter rifle fires slivers of crystallised toxin at high velocity. Each shard is designed to shatter on impact, spreading its lethal payload through the victim's body.
A massive Ork close combat weapon, essentially a crude axe or cleaver of enormous size. The Big Choppa is wielded by Ork Nobs and other large Orks who prize sheer destructive power over subtlety.

A large-calibre automatic weapon of crude Ork construction. The Big Shoota is essentially an oversized version of the standard Ork shoota, delivering a withering volume of fire at the expense of accuracy.

An Ork weapon that combines a crude flamer with a cutting torch, used in melee to slice through armour and flesh with superheated flame. Ork Burna Boyz use these to cut through both enemies and bulkheads with equal enthusiasm.
An Ork weapon that combines a crude flamer with a cutting torch. In ranged mode, it functions as a short-range flamer, spraying burning promethium over a wide area.

The standard close combat weapon of the Orks, a choppa is a crude but effective blade, axe, or cleaver. No two are alike, as each Ork customises his choppa to his own preferences, but all share a common purpose: chopping things.

The Ork version of a rocket launcher, firing crude but powerful self-propelled explosive projectiles. Rokkit Launchas are wildly inaccurate but devastating when they hit, which suits Ork doctrine perfectly.
The standard ranged weapon of the Orks, a shoota is a crude automatic firearm. Though wildly inaccurate and prone to jamming, the sheer volume of fire they produce makes them dangerous in Ork hands.

An Ork sidearm, the slugga is a crude, large-calibre pistol. Inaccurate and prone to malfunction, it nonetheless packs a considerable punch at close range, which is where most Orks prefer to fight anyway.

The Ork equivalent of a frag grenade, a stikkbomb is a crude explosive device typically consisting of a tin can filled with explosives and scrap metal, attached to a stick for throwing. Despite their ramshackle construction, they are surprisingly effective.

The signature weapon of the Kroot, this versatile weapon functions as both a ranged weapon and a formidable melee blade. Kroot Rifles fire solid rounds and feature vicious blades on both ends for close combat.
The Kroot Rifle used as a melee weapon, its vicious blades on both ends making it a deadly polearm in the hands of an experienced Kroot warrior.
A Tau-designed grenade that detonates in a blinding flash of light and deafening sonic pulse. Used primarily for defensive purposes, the photon grenade disorients and stuns rather than kills.
A Tau weapon that fires high-energy particle bursts. More compact than a pulse rifle, the carbine sacrifices some range for greater portability, and includes an underslung photon grenade launcher.
A compact Tau sidearm that fires high-energy particle bursts. Though small, it retains the impressive stopping power characteristic of all Tau pulse weapons.

The standard infantry weapon of the Tau Fire Warriors, the pulse rifle fires high-energy particle bursts at extreme range. It is considered one of the most effective basic infantry weapons in the galaxy, surpassing even the Imperial lasgun in range and stopping power.

A weapon from Xenos Cache D-216-98, this device projects a beam that strips away matter at the molecular level, causing catastrophic structural failure in anything it touches. The beam appears as a shimmering distortion in the air.
A weapon from Xenos Cache D-216-98, this lance-like device generates a cascading energy field along its length. In melee, it functions as a devastating power weapon.
A weapon from Xenos Cache D-216-98 that can discharge its energy field as a devastating ranged attack, releasing a bolt of cascading energy at the target.

A weapon from Xenos Cache D-216-98 that generates a focused beam of concussive force. The beam can stagger even the largest targets and is particularly effective at disabling vehicles and fortifications.

A weapon from Xenos Cache D-216-98, this blade has been sharpened to a monomolecular edge using alien technology. It can cut through virtually any material with ease, making it a terrifyingly effective melee weapon.

A weapon from Xenos Cache D-216-98 that fires an arc of resonating energy. The arc bounces between metallic objects and armoured targets, making it particularly effective against heavily armoured foes.

A weapon of a long-extinct alien species, the Akvran Cutter projects a thin beam of intensely focused energy capable of slicing through the hardest materials. The weapon's elegant design suggests a civilisation of considerable sophistication.

A biological weapon created by the Guldaniri, a xenos race long since exterminated. The projector launches a stream of highly corrosive biological acid that dissolves armour and organic matter with equal efficiency.

A bladed ring weapon of the extinct Havatian race, designed to be used as both a throwing weapon and a melee blade. In melee, the warrior grips the inner ring and uses the outer cutting edge to devastating effect.

A bladed ring weapon of the extinct Havatian race thrown with deadly precision. The ringblade arcs through the air, its monomolecular outer edge slicing through armour before returning to the thrower.
An alien grenade-like weapon of the Kyaire, a species long since extinct. Upon detonation, it releases a burst of razor-sharp crystalline fragments that shred everything within the blast radius.

A weapon of unknown alien origin that fires a beam that disrupts the target's neural pathways, causing seizures, paralysis, or death. The weapon is silent and leaves no visible wound, making it a perfect tool for covert elimination.

A curved alien blade of unknown origin, designed to be fitted over the wielder's forearm like a massive claw. The blade is composed of an unknown alloy that never dulls and seems to actively resist being damaged.

A devastating energy weapon created by the enigmatic Xenarch. It fires a searing arc of alien energy that chains between targets, leaping from one to the next with lethal results. The weapon's operation defies conventional understanding of physics.
